page.title: 13The Post Office Harpenden
page.content: We were surprised when visiting the Post Office sorting area to find the Bicycle Room. 50 postmen, 4 postwomen deliver up to 200,000 letters weekly, using Mail Vans and bikes. Twenty numbered bikes with a front rack to hold the postbag are in daily use. We visited a postman who has cycled miles in his 28 years service. Up at 04.00, he starts work at 05.00 sorting the mail for his morning round. He thinks bikes are safer and quicker. Modern letter boxes and dogs are the postman's worst enemies. He added that as Harpenden has grown there are many more houses and post to deliver. He remembers the chickens running free in Roundwood Lane and friendly chats with local people, which he misses. Nowadays although still friendly people are too busy to stop.
